description: A two-wheeled vehicle that you pedal to move.
A four-wheeled motor vehicle used for transportation.
A series of connected vehicles traveling on railways.
A small vessel for traveling over water.
An underground electric railroad in a city.
An aircraft with rotating blades that can hover and move in all directions.
A small vehicle with a low platform and two or three wheels.
A large, heavy road vehicle for carrying goods.
A narrow boat with pointed ends, propelled by paddles.
A boat or ship for conveying passengers and goods across water.
A short narrow board with two small wheels at each end.
A two-wheeled electric vehicle used for personal transportation.
A large bag filled with hot air or gas to make it rise in the air.
An aircraft without an engine, designed to glide after being towed aloft.
A vehicle designed to propel itself by ejecting exhaust gas from one end.
An aircraft powered by one or more jet engines.
A railway having a single track.
A vehicle moved by a continuously moving cable for transporting passengers.
A light two-wheeled hooded vehicle drawn by one or more people.
A medium-sized sailboat equipped for cruising or racing.
A vehicle of various forms, mounted on runners for sliding.
A vehicle that glides over a surface by blowing air downwards.
A large dirigible airship.
A watercraft capable of independent operation underwater.
A reusable spacecraft with wings for landing on a runway.
